answers.answer: Has your doctor done an Xray?  If you are concerned, he should be concerned.  You could have a bone spur, a fallen arch, a torn or strained ligament or tendon.  Seek a second opinion, ask for a referral to a podiatrist, anything you can do to get an answer.  Never let a doctor brush off a pain that is bothering you as nothing, because it could be something that needs to be taken care of.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Pain in the soles of feet can be due to plantar fasciitis, diabetes, Sjogren’s sundrome, peripheral neuropathies, hypothyroidism, SLE, alcoholism, peripheral artery disease, sciatica, sarcoidosis, amyloidosis and high blood pressure. You will need blood tests, nerve conduction studies and dopplar studies to reach a diagnosis.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Hope this helps. Take care!

title: Pain on the bottom of foot.
